name: Noctocol

features.name: Noctocol Downport
features.description: Sealed landing pad with corrosion-resistant coating. No refined fuel. Limited provisions. Constant maintenance against atmospheric degradation.
features.campaignNotes: Barely functional. The corrosive atmosphere eats everything.

features.name: Acid Haven
features.culture: Largest floating habitat. Government center. Close-knit isolation culture.
features.description: Floating habitat complex on the fluid oceans. Multiple connected pressure vessels linked by sealed tubes. The community's survival depends on absolute seal integrity.
features.campaignNotes: Director Kai Osmund runs this. Psionic contact Brother Fen lives here.

features.name: Processing Rig Seven
features.description: Industrial platform for exotic chemical processing. Harvests compounds from the corrosive atmosphere and fluid oceans for export.
features.campaignNotes: SuSAG sampling station attached. Dr. Vetch operates here.

features.name: The Deep Station
features.description: Subsurface research facility studying the fluid ocean chemistry. Partially submerged. Scientific community with unique environmental expertise.
features.campaignNotes: Potential adventure seed: deep sample retrieval.

regions.name: Corrosive Mists
regions.description: Landmasses exposed above the fluid oceans. Scoured by corrosive winds. The rock surface shows chemical weathering patterns. Iridescent mineral deposits visible.

regions.name: Fluid Oceans
regions.description: Non-water hydrocarbon oceans. Chemical composition varies by region. Surface shimmers with iridescent patterns. Floating habitats anchor to subsurface geological features.

arrivalBriefing:
Noctocol resolves as a world wrapped in sickly orange-yellow haze. The corrosive atmosphere is visible even from orbit â€” a toxic blanket that obscures the surface. Occasional breaks reveal the fluid oceans: shimmering, iridescent, and utterly lethal to unprotected materials.

The downport beacon guides you through the haze to a sealed landing pad. Even through the ship's hull, the atmospheric analysis reads like a chemistry textbook of things that dissolve metal.

gmQuickRef.population: 30M in sealed habitats. Nobody goes outside without specialized equipment.
gmQuickRef.hazards: Corrosive atmosphere (eats metal/organic). Exotic fluid oceans. Standard vacc suits corrode in hours.
gmQuickRef.firstImpressions: Orange haze, sealed everything, intense community bonds, outsiders tolerated not trusted.
